h1.aria-label: FUSD Expands and Adjusts Food Service Program
h1.span: FUSD Expands and Adjusts Food Service Program

i.span: Weekend meals will be available during Friday food service beginning next week

div.p: Beginning Monday, April 20, 2020, there will be some service changes as part of the "Grab and Go" Food Service program. The changes include expanding food service to include weekend meal disbursements during the Friday service where students will be able to take additional breakfasts and lunches home for over the weekend.

Mobile food service will be reduced to three times a week based on current service usage. All routes will continue on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday with meals for Tuesday shared during the Monday service, Thursday meals shared during Wednesday service, and Saturday and Sunday meals being shared during the Friday Service.

p.span: Additionally, a new mobile service route will be added for the Knowles and Sinagua area with sites including the following locations and times:
The meal site at Coconino High School will be closed due to low attendance, but area families are encouraged to use the meal service location at Killip Elementary.

Grab and Go breakfast and lunch meals will continue to be available for any child, age 18 and under, from 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m at Cromer Elementary, DeMiguel Elementary, Killip Elementary, Kinsey Elementary, Leupp Elementary, Marshall Elementary, and Thomas Elementary.
Following the acceptance of an Arizona Department of Education waiver, children do not have to be present if their parents or guardians wish to pick up the meal.
Dates are subject to change and will be updated as necessary.

Meals will be provided to all children, ages 18 and under, without charge and are the same for all children regardless of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age and there will be no discrimination in the course of the meal service. Both meals will be picked up at the same time.

In accordance with Federal civil rights law and U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) civil rights regulations and policies, the USDA, its Agencies, offices, and employees, and institutions participating in or administering USDA programs are prohibited from discriminating based on race, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, or reprisal or retaliation for prior civil rights activity in any program or activity conducted or funded by USDA.

Persons with disabilities who require alternative means of communication for program information (e.g., Braille, large print, audiotape, American Sign Language, etc.) should contact the Agency (State or local) where they applied for benefits. Individuals who are deaf, hard of hearing or have speech disabilities may contact USDA through the Federal Relay Service at (800) 877-8339. Additionally, program information may be made available in languages other than English.

To file a program complaint of discrimination, complete the USDA Program Discrimination Complaint Form, AD-3027, found online at http://www.ascr.usda.gov/complaint_filing_cust.html, and at any USDA office, or write a letter addressed to USDA and provide in the letter all of the information requested in the form. To request a copy of the complaint form, call (866) 632-9992. Submit your completed form or letter to USDA by: (1) mail: U.S. Department of Agriculture, Office of the Assistant Secretary for Civil Rights, 1400 Independence Avenue, SW, Washington, D.C. 20250-9410; (2) fax: (202) 690-7442; or (3) email: program.intake@usda.gov.
This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

span.strong: FUSD expande y ajusta el programa de servicio de alimentos

br.em: Las comidas de fin de semana estarn disponibles durante el servicio de comida del viernes a partir de la prxima semana.

p.span: A partir del lunes 20 de abril de 2020, habr algunos cambios en el servicio como parte del programa de servicio de alimentos "Grab and Go". Los cambios incluyen la expansin del servicio de alimentos para incluir los desembolsos de comidas de fin de semana durante el servicio del viernes, donde los estudiantes podrn tomar desayunos y almuerzos adicionales en casa durante el fin de semana.

El servicio mvil de alimentos se reducir a tres veces por semana segn el uso actual del servicio. Todas las rutas continuarn los lunes, mircoles y viernes con las comidas del martes compartidas durante el servicio del lunes, las comidas del jueves compartidas durante el servicio del mircoles y las comidas del sbado y domingo compartidas durante el servicio del viernes.
Adems, se agregar una nueva ruta de servicio mvil para el rea de Knowles y Sinagua con sitios que incluyen los siguientes lugares y horarios:

li.span: 1001 N Fourth St. (8:30 a.m. a 9:00 a.m.)

p.span: El sitio de comidas en la Escuela Secundaria Coconino estar cerrado debido a la baja asistencia, pero se alienta a las familias del rea a usar el lugar de servicio de comidas en Killip Elementary.

Los desayunos y almuerzos "Grab and Go" continuarn disponibles para cualquier nio, de 18 aos de edad y menores, de 8:30 a.m. a 12:30 p.m. en Cromer Elementary, DeMiguel Elementary, Killip Elementary, Kinsey Elementary, Leupp Elementary, Marshall Elemental y Thomas Elemental.
Luego de la aceptacin de una exencin del Departamento de Educacin de Arizona, los nios no tienen que estar presentes si sus padres o tutores desean recoger la comida.
Las fechas estn sujetas a cambios y se actualizarn segn sea necesario.

Se proporcionarn comidas a todos los nios, menores de 18 aos, sin cargo y son las mismas para todos los nios, independientemente de su raza, color, nacionalidad, sexo, discapacidad o edad, y no habr discriminacin en el curso del servicio de comidas. . Ambas comidas sern recogidas al mismo tiempo.

De acuerdo con la ley federal de derechos civiles y las regulaciones y polticas de derechos civiles del Departamento de Agricultura de los Estados Unidos (USDA), el USDA, sus agencias, oficinas y empleados e instituciones que participan o administran programas del USDA tienen prohibido discriminar por raza, color, origen nacional, sexo, discapacidad, edad o represalias o represalias por actividades anteriores de derechos civiles en cualquier programa o actividad realizada o financiada por el USDA.

Las personas con discapacidades que requieren medios de comunicacin alternativos para la informacin del programa (por ejemplo, Braille, letra grande, cinta de audio, lenguaje de seas americano, etc.) deben comunicarse con la Agencia (estatal o local) donde solicitaron los beneficios. Las personas sordas, con dificultades auditivas o del habla pueden comunicarse con el USDA a travs del Servicio Federal de Retransmisin al (800) 877-8339. Adems, la informacin del programa puede estar disponible en otros idiomas adems del ingls.

Para presentar una queja de discriminacin del programa, complete el Formulario de queja de discriminacin del programa del USDA, AD-3027, que se encuentra en lnea en http://www.ascr.usda.gov/complaint_filing_cust.html, y en cualquier oficina del USDA, o escriba una carta dirigida al USDA y proporcione en la carta toda la informacin solicitada en el formulario. Para solicitar una copia del formulario de queja, llame al (866) 632-9992. Enve su formulario o carta completa al USDA por: (1) correo: Departamento de Agricultura de EE. UU., Oficina del Subsecretario de Derechos Civiles, 1400 Independence Avenue, SW, Washington, DC 20250-9410; (2) fax: (202) 690-7442; o (3) correo electrnico: program.intake@usda.gov.
Esta institucin es un proveedor de igualdad de oportunidades.

h1.aria-label: Instruction, Grading, Testing, Graduation Update - April 2, 2020
h1.span: Instruction, Grading, Testing, Graduation Update - April 2, 2020

div.p:
FUSD Parents and Families,
The announcement earlier this week to close all Arizona public schools for the rest of the 2019-2020 school year, in response to the COVID-19 pandemic, has brought us more certainty about how FUSD will serve its students in these final weeks. I know that students and families, just like our Team members of FUSD, have felt sadness as this new reality sets in. While understanding and supporting this decision to close schools for safety reasons, we have come to the realization that we will not be able to welcome our students back into our schools this spring and that many of the events and traditions which typically occur to celebrate the end of a successful school year will not be held in the same way as they have in the past.
I am proud of the flexibility, effort, and heart demonstrated by Team FUSD in these last two weeks as they have adapted to a new way of working together and providing services to our students and families. With school staff, students, and families as partners, we will keep moving FUSD and student learning forward one day at time. Our schools are not closed - just our buildings.
Instructional Resources and New Learning
This week FUSD launched the Digital Learning Hub, available on FUSDs website, which contains online instructional resources organized by grade level and content areas in order to provide consistent and equitable access across our District. Resources to support social emotional and the differentiated needs of learners are also available on the Digital Learning Hub. Teams of teachers across FUSD are working collaboratively to add new learning content and resources to the Digital Hub and these will continue to be added each week throughout the end of this school year beginning Monday. Additionally, teachers may make new learning opportunities available to students, to enhance the resources available on the Digital Hub, which are specific to grade level expectations, course standards, and the needs of their students through Google Classroom and instructional applications, individual videoconferencing, email, or phone.
Alternative resources, including paper materials sent via U.S. mail, for those students and families without access to online instructional resources will be provided if requested and in coordination with teachers and school administrators. As a precaution related to the spread of COVID-19, paper materials will not be able to be returned to schools. Teachers and schools administrators will work with students and families to develop procedures, such as submitting a photo or a phone conference, for assignments needing teacher feedback or to be graded.
Teacher and staff schedules, generally between the hours of 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., include time each day for connecting with students and supporting their learning in addition to their other professional duties. Contact information for schools, teachers, and staff is available on school websites and the Digital Learning Hub.
Grading Practices and Graduation Requirements
The state legislature and Governor authorized school districts to have a two week timeframe in which instruction was not required and instructional time/days missed due to the closure would not be required to be made-up by students. We have needed every bit of these two weeks to transition Team FUSD to working offsite, make connections with students, and prepare to deliver quality new learning opportunities in different ways. Based on guidance released earlier this week from the State Board of Education, beginning on April 6, 2020, students will have the opportunity to improve second semester grades by completing new assignments during the remaining weeks of the 2019-2020 school year and by resubmitting past assignments from the 3rd quarter and those posted in gradebooks by Friday, March 13, 2020 prior to spring break. Student grades for the second semester of the 2019-2020 school year will be calculated based on the 3rd quarter grades, resubmitted past assignments, and completion of new assignments during the last weeks of this school year. There will be no penalty for students not completing new work or resubmitting past assignments during this school closure. Parents looking to review grades can do so through the ParentVUE resource accessible here.
Grades will not be lowered from the posted 3rd quarter grade, they can only be improved. For secondary students, these grades will be used to issue full credits for the 2nd semester of the 2019-2020 school year, meet graduation requirements, and award diplomas to senior students. FUSD staff aim to use these last weeks of this school year to move all students learning forward so they are prepared for the next step in their educational career.
Testing and Exams
Statewide assessments for students are cancelled for the 2019-2020 school year. This includes AzMz, AIMS Science, MSAA, and AZELLA. As a requirement for graduation, students are still required by statute to receive a 60% or better score on the Civics exam. Staff from each of the FUSD high schools will contact any senior students needing arrangements for this test completion.
Students previously scheduled to take AP exams are able to cancel AP testing fees at no charge if they wish. For the 2019-2020 school year, students are able to take a shortened 45-minute free-response AP test at home. Test dates have been posted to the College Board website and are now scheduled between May 4-8 and May 11-15.
ACT has postponed state and district testing for Spring.and is currently posting a new date of June 13 on its website. The May date for SAT exams is cancelled and there is currently no new information about when the next SAT testing opportunity will be provided.
Northern Arizona Distance Learning (NADL)
As an alternative option for students in grades 7 to 12, FUSD does have an online program - Northern Arizona Distance Learning (NADL) which offers over 90 online middle school and high school courses for students who desire an alternative to the traditional school setting. Upon enrollment students enter semester long, independent study courses designed to be completed in 18 weeks or less. All new students begin courses at the start of the semester and therefore can enroll 365 days of the year.

Due to the flexibility of NADLs structure, beginning a course mid-semester is not ideal. Therefore, it is not the districts recommendation that students transition from their traditional school of choice to NADL currently. However, NADL would welcome students seeking an alternative to the brick and mortar school setting long-term, or are interested in summer course advancement or grade replacement. Students/families interested in these opportunities should reach out to NADL Director Renee Rosales via email at RRosales@fusd1.org for additional information.

p.br:
All student trips for the duration of the school year have been postponed or cancelled. Staff, students, and families alike are disappointed as we were all looking forward to these learning opportunities. School staff will work with families to refund monies, to the extent possible, for trips which cannot be rescheduled. Unfortunately, tax credits cannot be refunded, but can be redirected to other programs.
Graduation ceremonies and high school prom are postponed at this time. FUSD intends to reschedule these events at a later time or with the input of senior students, high school administration and staff, and families, to organize alternative experiences to celebrate our students accomplishments
Closing
Thank you all for your patience and understanding and please be well during this time. I understand students and families are anxious to know when and how to retrieve any personal items left at school now that the closure of our buildings has extended through the end of the school year. We recommend this process be done at a later time when the Stay Home, Stay Healthy, Stay Connected order issued by the Governor is lifted and it is safer to do so.
For more information and helpful resource links on the FUSD COVID-19 response, please visit www.fusd1.org/coronavirus.
Sincerely,
Michael Penca
Superintendent

Padres y familias de FUSD,
El anuncio a principios de esta semana de cerrar todas las escuelas pblicas de Arizona durante el resto del ao escolar 2019-2020, en respuesta a la pandemia de COVID-19, nos ha dado ms certeza sobre cmo FUSD servir a sus estudiantes en estas ltimas semanas. S que los estudiantes y las familias, al igual que los miembros de nuestro Equipo de FUSD, se han sentido tristes cuando esta nueva realidad se establece. Mientras entendemos y apoyamos esta decisin de cerrar las escuelas por razones de seguridad, nos hemos dado cuenta de que no podremos para dar la bienvenida a nuestros estudiantes a nuestras escuelas esta primavera y que muchos de los eventos y tradiciones que generalmente se producen para celebrar el final de un ao escolar exitoso no se llevarn a cabo de la misma manera que en el pasado.
Estoy orgulloso de la flexibilidad, el esfuerzo y el corazn demostrados por el Equipo FUSD en estas ltimas dos semanas, ya que se han adaptado a una nueva forma de trabajar juntos y brindar servicios a nuestros estudiantes y familias. Con el personal escolar, los estudiantes y las familias como socios, seguiremos avanzando FUSD y el aprendizaje de los estudiantes un da a la vez. Nuestras escuelas no estn cerradas, solo nuestros edificios.
Recursos didcticos y nuevo aprendizaje
Esta semana, FUSD lanz el Centro de Aprendizaje Digital, disponible en el sitio web de FUSD, que contiene recursos de instruccin en lnea organizados por nivel de grado y reas de contenido para proporcionar un acceso consistente y equitativo en todo nuestro Distrito. Los recursos para apoyar las necesidades sociales, emocionales y diferenciadas de los alumnos tambin estn disponibles en Digital Learning Hub. Los equipos de maestros en todo el FUSD estn trabajando en colaboracin para agregar nuevos contenidos y recursos de aprendizaje al Digital Hub y estos se seguirn agregando cada semana durante el final de este ao escolar a partir del lunes. Adems, los maestros pueden poner a disposicin de los estudiantes nuevas oportunidades de aprendizaje, para mejorar los recursos disponibles en el Digital Hub, que son especficos para las expectativas de nivel de grado, los estndares del curso y las necesidades de sus estudiantes a travs de Google Classroom y aplicaciones de instruccin, videoconferencia individual, correo electrnico o por telfono.
Se proporcionarn recursos alternativos, incluidos materiales en papel enviados por correo de EE. UU., Para aquellos estudiantes y familias que no tengan acceso a recursos educativos en lnea, si as se solicita, y en coordinacin con los maestros y administradores escolares. Como precaucin relacionada con la propagacin de COVID-19, los materiales en papel no podrn devolverse a las escuelas. Los maestros y los administradores de las escuelas trabajarn con los estudiantes y las familias para desarrollar procedimientos, como enviar una foto o una conferencia telefnica, para las tareas que necesitan comentarios de los maestros o para ser calificadas.
Los horarios de los maestros y el personal, generalmente entre las 8:00 a.m. y las 4:00 p.m., incluyen tiempo cada da para conectarse con los estudiantes y apoyar su aprendizaje, adems de sus otras tareas profesionales. La informacin de contacto de las escuelas, los maestros y el personal est disponible en los sitios web de las escuelas y en el Digital Learning Hub.
Prcticas de calificacin y requisitos de graduacin
La legislatura estatal y el gobernador autorizaron a los distritos escolares a tener un plazo de dos semanas en el que no se requera instruccin y los estudiantes no tendran que recuperar el tiempo / das de instruccin perdidos debido al cierre. Hemos necesitado cada parte de estas dos semanas para hacer la transicin del Equipo FUSD a trabajar fuera del sitio, establecer conexiones con los estudiantes y prepararnos para ofrecer nuevas oportunidades de aprendizaje de calidad de diferentes maneras. Segn la gua publicada a principios de esta semana por la Junta de Educacin del Estado, a partir del 6 de abril de 2020, los estudiantes tendrn la oportunidad de mejorar las calificaciones del segundo semestre al completar nuevas tareas durante las semanas restantes del ao escolar 2019-2020 y volver a presentar tareas del tercer trimestre y las publicadas en los libros de calificaciones antes del viernes 13 de marzo de 2020 antes de las vacaciones de primavera. Las calificaciones de los estudiantes para el segundo semestre del ao escolar 2019-2020 se calcularn en funcin de las calificaciones del tercer trimestre, las tareas pasadas reenviadas y la finalizacin de nuevas tareas durante las ltimas semanas de este ao escolar. No habr penalidad para los estudiantes que no completen un nuevo trabajo o reenven tareas pasadas durante el cierre de esta escuela. Los padres que deseen revisar las calificaciones pueden hacerlo a travs del recurso ParentVUE accesible aqu.
Las calificaciones no se reducirn de la calificacin publicada del tercer trimestre, solo se pueden mejorar. Para estudiantes de secundaria, estas calificaciones se utilizarn para emitir crditos completos para el segundo semestre del ao escolar 2019-2020, cumplir con los requisitos de graduacin y otorgar diplomas a estudiantes de ltimo ao. El personal del FUSD tiene como objetivo utilizar estas ltimas semanas de este ao escolar para avanzar en el aprendizaje de todos los estudiantes para que estn preparados para el prximo paso en su carrera educativa.
Pruebas y Exmenes
Las evaluaciones estatales para estudiantes se cancelan para el ao escolar 2019-2020. Esto incluye AzMz, AIMS Science, MSAA y AZELLA. Como requisito para la graduacin, los estatutos an requieren que los estudiantes reciban un puntaje de 60% o ms en el examen de educacin cvica. El personal de cada una de las escuelas secundarias del FUSD se comunicar con los estudiantes mayores que necesiten arreglos para completar esta prueba.
Los estudiantes previamente programados para tomar los exmenes AP pueden cancelar las tarifas de las pruebas AP sin cargo si lo desean. Para el ao escolar 2019-2020, los estudiantes pueden tomar un examen AP de respuesta libre de 45 minutos en casa. Las fechas de los exmenes se publicaron en el sitio web de College Board y ahora estn programadas entre el 4 y el 8 de mayo y del 11 al 15 de mayo.
ACT ha pospuesto las pruebas estatales y distritales para Spring.Actualmente est publicando una nueva fecha del 13 de junio en su sitio web. La fecha de mayo para los exmenes SAT se cancela y actualmente no hay informacin nueva sobre cundo se proporcionar la prxima oportunidad de examen SAT.
Aprendizaje a distancia del norte de Arizona (NADL)
Como una opcin alternativa para estudiantes en los grados 7 a 12, FUSD tiene un programa en lnea: Northern Arizona Distance Learning (NADL) que ofrece ms de 90 cursos en lnea de escuela intermedia y secundaria para estudiantes que desean una alternativa al entorno escolar tradicional. Al inscribirse, los estudiantes ingresan a cursos de estudio independientes de un semestre de largo diseados para completarse en 18 semanas o menos. Todos los estudiantes nuevos comienzan los cursos al comienzo del semestre y, por lo tanto, pueden inscribirse los 365 das del ao.
Debido a la flexibilidad de la estructura de NADL, comenzar un curso a mitad de semestre no es lo ideal. Por lo tanto, no es la recomendacin del distrito que la transicin del estudiante de su escuela tradicional de eleccin a NADL actualmente. Sin embargo, NADL les dara la bienvenida a los estudiantes que buscan una alternativa a la escuela de ladrillo y mortero a largo plazo, o estn interesados en el avance del curso de verano o el reemplazo de grado. Los estudiantes / familias interesados en estas oportunidades deben comunicarse con la Directora de NADL, Renee Rosales, por correo electrnico a RRosales@fusd1.org para obtener informacin adicional.
Viajes de estudiantes y eventos
Todos los viajes de los estudiantes durante el ao escolar han sido pospuestos o cancelados. El personal, los estudiantes y las familias estn decepcionados, ya que todos estbamos esperando estas oportunidades de aprendizaje. El personal de la escuela trabajar con las familias para reembolsar el dinero, en la medida de lo posible, para los viajes que no se pueden reprogramar. Lamentablemente, los crditos fiscales no se pueden reembolsar, pero se pueden redirigir a otros programas.
Las ceremonias de graduacin y el baile de graduacin de la escuela secundaria se posponen en este momento. FUSD tiene la intencin de reprogramar estos eventos en un momento posterior o con el aporte de los estudiantes de ltimo ao, la administracin y el personal de la escuela secundaria y las familias, para organizar experiencias alternativas para celebrar los logros de nuestros estudiantes
Clausura
Gracias a todos por su paciencia y comprensin y por favor estn bien durante este tiempo. Entiendo que los estudiantes y las familias estn ansiosos por saber cundo y cmo recuperar cualquier artculo personal que quede en la escuela ahora que el cierre de nuestros edificios se ha extendido hasta el final del ao escolar. Recomendamos que este proceso se realice ms adelante cuando se levanta la orden "Qudese en casa, mantngase saludable, mantngase conectado" emitida por el Gobernador y es ms seguro hacerlo.
Para obtener ms informacin y enlaces de recursos tiles sobre la respuesta FUSD COVID-19, visite www.fusd1.org/coronavirus.
Sinceramente,
Michael Penca
Superintendente

h1.aria-label: Announcement: All Arizona Schools Closed for Remainder of School Year
h1.span: Announcement: All Arizona Schools Closed for Remainder of School Year

div.p: Good Morning FUSD Families and Team Members,

p.span: This morning Governor Doug Ducey and Superintendent of Public Instruction Kathy Hoffman announced that all public schools in Arizona will be closed through the rest of the 2019-2020 school year in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. This includes all schools and programs of the Flagstaff Unified School District (FUSD).

While we understand this decision has a significant impact on the FUSD and the greater Flagstaff community, we appreciate the clarity this decision provides and the ability to now make plans for this extended closure. The FUSD leadership team is meeting today to make additional plans in response to this new decision.
We are committed to keep you up to date on the actions FUSD is taking in accordance with this action.
For the most up to date information on COVID-19 and FUSD operations, please see
Thank you for your patience in this developing and unprecedented situation.
Sincerely,
Michael Penca
Superintendent

span.strong: Flagstaff Unified School District Digital Hub Now Available

div.p: With the closure of all FUSD schools in response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the Flagstaff Unified School District believes it is important to continue supporting student learning opportunities regardless of location.

As an educational institution we will continue to provide and support the learners within FUSD. We have developed the Digital Learning Hub with resources defined by grade level, content area, community supports within Flagstaff, social-emotional opportunities, special education resources and fun activities that will support this new remote learning environment. The educational resources support Arizona Standards and provide varied levels in order to support learning abilities.

p.a: ACCESS THE FUSD DIGITAL HUB HERE

div.p: We will continue to build out this site in the coming weeks with specific learning plans by week.
These resources are to supplement the work by Team FUSD as a baseline for teacher and family partnerships. Our team members are reaching out to families and we encourage continuing partnerships.

Families are encouraged to reach out to their child's teacher for additional needed support for instructional materials or questions. If families are unable to download any materials or need printed copies they may contact their site administrator for assistance.
Happy learning.

h1.aria-label: March 26, 2020 Update - Special Meeting, Testing Updates, Food Service Expansion, and Health Reminders
h1.span: March 26, 2020 Update - Special Meeting, Testing Updates, Food Service Expansion, and Health Reminders

p.span: Good Evening FUSD Families,
On behalf of Team FUSD, thank you for your continued patience and flexibility as we continue to adapt to this new way of providing services and support to our students and families.

Please know the order to close our schools is made, first and foremost, with the consideration of the safety and wellbeing of students and families, our Team FUSD members, and the vulnerable members of our communities.
We are committed to keeping you informed as conditions continue to change in our community and state.

On Monday, March 30, 2020 at 4:30 p.m., the Flagstaff Unified School District Governing Board will hold a special meeting to provide the public with an update of FUSDs COVID-19 response actions. The public is not encouraged to attend the meeting in person for social distancing purposes, but rather the meeting will be available via live stream on Facebook, Twitter, and Vimeo. If you have questions regarding FUSDs COVID-19 response that you would like to have answered during this meeting, please submit them to our Communications Team by 3:30 p.m. on March 30, 2020 at

I am proud of our teachers, staff, and administrators for the connections they have made with FUSDs students and families this week. They have shown the care and concern we have for each of our students and it has allowed us to determine the ability of each student to access learning remotely or if other alternatives need to be made. On Monday, March 30, FUSD will launch a learning hub containing online resources so all of our students have consistent access to learning experiences and resources. Teachers and staff will enhance these resources with additional learning opportunities specific to grade level expectations, course standards, and the needs of students. More details for students and parents will be sent out on Sunday evening.
This week, we have received additional updates about student testing.

For the 2019-2020 school year, students are able to take a shortened 45-minute free-response test at home. More information on this option will be sent out to impacted families by their teachers. Test dates for course exams will be posted to the College Board website no later than Friday, April 3rd. Students and families are able to cancel AP testing fees at no charge if they prefer.

All ACT State and District testing dates have been canceled while the Arizona Department of Education is working with ACT to find an alternative date. ACT is posting a new date of June 13 on its website, however, this may not be for State and District Testing. We will continue to learn more about next steps and will update with new information.
The May 2nd testing date for SAT has been canceled and there is no additional information about when the next SAT testing opportunity will be provided.

ADE is currently seeking a waiver with the U.S. Department of Education to cancel state achievement testing for the 2019-2020 school year. FUSD will notify families once the status of the waiver request is known.
FUSD is currently seeking guidance from ADE about how to help seniors meet the Civics Test graduation requirement.

p.b: Grab and Go Food Service Expansion

p.span: Beginning on Wednesday, April 1, 2020, the Grab and Go Food Service program will be expanded to additional mobile sites located in Mountainaire, Kachina, Munds Park, Bow & Arrow, Lumberjack Store and along Leupp Rd. The mobile locations will be next to FUSD white buses. The addresses of the sites are:

li.span: Zuni & Kofa @ the Cul de Sac (8:30-9:00am)
Zuni Drive & Cochise Dr @ Bow & Arrow Park (9:03-9:33)

p.span: Grab and Go breakfast and lunch meals will continue to be available for any child, age 18 and under, from 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m at Coconino High, Cromer Elementary, Killip Elementary, Kinsey Elementary, Leupp Elementary, Marshall Elementary, and Thomas Elementary. Children do not have to be a student at those schools or FUSD to be served, but must be present to receive a meal.

p.b: Health information for you and your family:

p.span: Here are a few helpful links from the Center of Disease Control (CDC), Arizona Department of Health Services (ADHS), and Coconino County Health and Human Services (CCHHS). If you have questions related to COVID-19 these are great resources to answer your questions.

a.span: Coconino County Health and Human Services

p.span: I understand students and families have many questions about making-up instructional time missed due to the closure, student testing and exams, graduation requirements, and scheduled activities/events. As we receive more guidance from the Arizona Department of Education and other sources, we pledge to keep you informed.
For the most up to date information on FUSDs COVID-19 response, please see
Sincerely,
Michael A. Penca
Superintendent
Buenas tardes familias del FUSD,

En nombre del Equipo FUSD, gracias por su paciencia y flexibilidad continuas a medida que continuamos adaptndonos a esta nueva forma de proporcionar servicios y apoyo a nuestros estudiantes y familias. Tenga en cuenta que la orden para cerrar nuestras escuelas se realiza, ante todo, con la consideracin de la seguridad y el bienestar de los estudiantes y las familias, los miembros de nuestro Equipo FUSD y los miembros vulnerables de nuestras comunidades. Nos comprometemos a mantenerlo informado a medida que las condiciones continen cambiando en nuestra comunidad y estado.

El lunes 30 de marzo de 2020 a las 4:30 p.m., la Junta de Gobierno del Distrito Escolar Unificado de Flagstaff llevar a cabo una reunin especial para proporcionar al pblico una actualizacin de las acciones de respuesta COVID-19 del FUSD. No se alienta al pblico a asistir a la reunin en persona con fines de distanciamiento social, sino que la reunin estar disponible a travs de transmisin en vivo en Facebook, Twitter y Vimeo. Si tiene preguntas sobre la respuesta COVID-19 del FUSD que le gustara haber respondido durante esta reunin, envelas a nuestro Equipo de comunicaciones antes de las 3:30 p.m. el 30 de marzo de 2020 en fusdcommunications@fusd1.org.

Estoy orgulloso de nuestros maestros, personal y administradores por las conexiones que han hecho con los estudiantes y las familias de FUSD esta semana. Han demostrado el cuidado y la preocupacin que tenemos por cada uno de nuestros estudiantes y nos ha permitido determinar la capacidad de cada estudiante para acceder al aprendizaje de forma remota o si se necesitan otras alternativas. El lunes 30 de marzo, FUSD lanzar un centro de aprendizaje que contiene recursos en lnea para que todos nuestros estudiantes tengan acceso constante a experiencias y recursos de aprendizaje. Los maestros y el personal mejorarn estos recursos con oportunidades de aprendizaje adicionales especficas para las expectativas de nivel de grado, los estndares del curso y las necesidades de los estudiantes. Se enviarn ms detalles para estudiantes y padres el domingo por la noche.
Esta semana, hemos recibido actualizaciones adicionales sobre las pruebas de los estudiantes.

Para el ao escolar 2019-2020, los estudiantes pueden tomar una prueba abreviada de respuesta libre de 45 minutos en casa. Sus maestros enviarn ms informacin sobre esta opcin a las familias afectadas. Las fechas de los exmenes de los cursos se publicarn en el sitio web de College Board a ms tardar el viernes 3 de abril. Los estudiantes y las familias pueden cancelar las tarifas de las pruebas AP sin cargo si lo prefieren.

Todas las fechas de exmenes estatales y distritales de ACT han sido canceladas mientras el Departamento de Educacin de Arizona est trabajando con ACT para encontrar una fecha alternativa. ACT publicar una nueva fecha del 13 de junio en su sitio web, sin embargo, esto puede no ser para pruebas estatales y distritales. Continuaremos aprendiendo ms sobre los prximos pasos y actualizaremos con nueva informacin.
La fecha de examen del 2 de mayo para SAT se ha cancelado y no hay informacin adicional sobre cundo se proporcionar la prxima oportunidad de examen SAT.

ADE est buscando una exencin con el Departamento de Educacin de los EE. UU. Para cancelar las pruebas de rendimiento estatales para el ao escolar 2019-2020. FUSD notificar a las familias una vez que se conozca el estado de la solicitud de exencin.

i.span: Requisito de graduacin de prueba cvica

p.span: El FUSD est buscando orientacin de ADE sobre cmo ayudar a las personas mayores a cumplir con el requisito de graduacin de la Prueba Cvica.

p.b: Expansin del servicio de comida Grab and Go

p.span: A partir del mircoles 1 de abril de 2020, el programa de servicio de comida "Grab and Go" se ampliar a sitios mviles adicionales ubicados en Mountainaire, Kachina, Munds Park, Bow & Arrow, Lumberjack Store y a lo largo de Leupp Rd. Las ubicaciones mviles estarn al lado de los autobuses blancos del FUSD. Las direcciones de los sitios son:

li.span: Zuni y Kofa @ the Cul de Sac (8:30 a.m.-9: 00 a.m.)
Zuni Drive & Cochise Dr @ Bow & Arrow Park (9: 03 a.m.-9: 33 a.m.)
Kachina Trail @ Raymond Park (9:10 a.m.-9:40 a.m.)
37 Pinewood Blvd @ the Post Office (9:50 a.m.-10: 20 a.m.)
6885 Lumberjack @ The Lumberjack Store (8:30 a.m.-8: 45 a.m.)
Rustler Rd y Leupp Rd (8: 51 a.m.-9:01 a.m.)
S Horn Rd y Leupp Rd (9: 14 a.m.-9:24 a.m.)

p.span: El desayuno y almuerzo "Grab and Go" continuar estando disponible para cualquier nio, de 18 aos de edad y menores, de 8:30 a.m. a 12:30 p.m. en Coconino High, Cromer Elementary, Killip Elementary, Kinsey Elementary, Leupp Elementary, Marshall Elemental y Thomas Elemental. Los nios no tienen que ser estudiantes en esas escuelas o FUSD para ser atendidos, sino que deben estar presentes para recibir una comida.

p.b: Informacin de salud para usted y su familia:

p.span: Aqu hay algunos enlaces tiles del Centro de Control de Enfermedades (CDC), el Departamento de Servicios de Salud de Arizona (ADHS) y los Servicios Humanos y de Salud del Condado de Coconino (CCHHS). Si tiene preguntas relacionadas con COVID-19, estos son excelentes recursos para responder sus preguntas.

li.span: Servicios de Salud y Humanos del Condado de Coconino

p.span: Entiendo que los estudiantes y las familias tienen muchas preguntas sobre cmo recuperar el tiempo de instruccin perdido debido al cierre, las pruebas y exmenes de los estudiantes, los requisitos de graduacin y las actividades / eventos programados. A medida que recibamos ms orientacin del Departamento de Educacin de Arizona y otras fuentes, nos comprometemos a mantenerlo informado. Para obtener la informacin ms actualizada sobre la respuesta COVID-19 del FUSD, visite www.fusd1.org/coronavirus.
Sinceramente,
Michael A. Penca
Superintendente

div.p: Good Evening FUSD Families,

p.span: Thank you for your patience as we all adapt to the closure of schools in response to COVID-19. Today, and for much of this week, our focus is on supporting the over 1,300 employees of the Flagstaff Unified School District as they return from our Districts previously scheduled spring break and we establish new practices for them to work safely from home with the resources they will need to successfully provide services to students in the weeks ahead.

Teachers and school staff will be contacting students and parents/families over the next days to check-in with students and determine if they are able to access online instructional resources or if alternatives need to be planned. Our Curriculum & Instruction, administrative, and teacher teams are working together to develop an organized and meaningful model for remote learning. FUSD is committed to offering all students access to quality learning opportunities and resources no later than Monday, March 30, 2020. More details for students and parents will be sent out later this week.

Today, we began serving Grab and Go breakfast and lunch meals for any child, age 18 and under, and all students who fall under IDEA. Meals are available from 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m at Coconino High School, Cromer Elementary, Killip Elementary, Kinsey Elementary, Leupp Elementary, Marshall Magnet Elementary, and Thomas Elementary. Over 800 students were served today! Additionally, the Flagstaff Food Center is providing free sack dinners each day from 4:00 p.m. to 5:30 p.m. at 3805 E. Huntington Drive. Food boxes will also be available Tuesday through Saturday from 9:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. More information from the Flagstaff Food Center is available at hotfood.org.

On behalf of Team FUSD, we appreciate your understanding and enthusiasm for continued learning. We know students and families have questions about making-up instructional time missed due to the closure, student testing and exams, and graduation requirements for seniors. As we receive guidance from the Arizona Department of Education, we pledge to keep you informed. For the most up to date information on FUSDs COVID-19 response, please see
Sincerely,
Michael A. Penca
Superintendent
Buenas tardes familias del FUSD,

Gracias por su paciencia mientras todos nos adaptamos al cierre de las escuelas en respuesta a COVID-19. Hoy, y durante gran parte de esta semana, nos enfocamos en apoyar a los ms de 1,300 empleados del Distrito Escolar Unificado de Flagstaff cuando regresan de las vacaciones de primavera programadas previamente de nuestro Distrito y establecemos nuevas prcticas para que trabajen de manera segura desde su hogar con los recursos que necesitar proporcionar servicios exitosamente a los estudiantes en las prximas semanas.

Los maestros y el personal de la escuela se comunicarn con los estudiantes y los padres / familias durante los prximos das para registrarse con los estudiantes y determinar si pueden acceder a los recursos de instruccin en lnea o si es necesario planificar alternativas. Nuestros equipos de Currculo e Instruccin, administrativos y de maestros estn trabajando juntos para desarrollar un modelo organizado y significativo para el aprendizaje remoto. FUSD se compromete a ofrecer a todos los estudiantes acceso a oportunidades y recursos de aprendizaje de calidad a ms tardar el lunes 30 de marzo de 2020. Ms detalles para los estudiantes y los padres se enviarn ms adelante esta semana.

Hoy, comenzamos a servir desayunos y almuerzos "Grab and Go" para cualquier nio, de 18 aos o menos, y para todos los estudiantes que caen bajo IDEA. Las comidas estn disponibles de 8:30 a.m. a 12:30 p.m. en las escuelas secundarias Coconino, Cromer, Killip, Kinsey, Leupp, Marshall Magnet y Thomas. Ms de 800 estudiantes fueron atendidos hoy! Adems, el Flagstaff Food Center ofrece cenas gratuitas cada da a partir de las 4:00 p.m. a las 5:30 p.m. en 3805 E. Huntington Drive. Las cajas de comida tambin estarn disponibles de martes a sbado de 9:00 a.m. a 1:00 p.m. Ms informacin del Flagstaff Food Center est disponible en hotfood.org.

En nombre del Equipo FUSD, apreciamos su comprensin y entusiasmo por continuar aprendiendo. Sabemos que los estudiantes y las familias tienen preguntas sobre el tiempo de instruccin de recuperacin perdido debido al cierre, las pruebas y exmenes de los estudiantes, y los requisitos de graduacin para las personas mayores. A medida que recibimos orientacin del Departamento de Educacin de Arizona, nos comprometemos a mantenerlo informado. Para obtener la informacin ms actualizada sobre la respuesta COVID-19 del FUSD, consulte
Sinceramente,
Michael A. Penca
Superintendente

This afternoon, Governor Doug Ducey and Superintendent of Public Instruction Kathy Hoffman extended the closure of all Arizona schools through Friday, April 10, 2020. This extension includes all schools in the Flagstaff Unified School District.

As a reminder, starting Monday, March 23, Grab and Go breakfast and lunch meals will be available for any child, age 18 and under, from 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m at Coconino High, Cromer Elementary, Killip Elementary, Kinsey Elementary, Leupp Elementary, Marshall Elementary, and Thomas Elementary. Children do not have to be a student at those schools or FUSD to be served.
For the most up to date information on FUSDs COVID-19 response, please see
Thank you.
Michael A. Penca
Superintendent
Buenas tardes FUSD Familias y miembros del equipo,

Esta tarde, el Gobernador Doug Ducey y la Superintendente de Instruccin Pblica Kathy Hoffman extendieron el cierre de todas las escuelas de Arizona hasta el viernes 10 de abril de 2020. Esta extensin incluye todas las escuelas en FUSD.

Como recordatorio, a partir del lunes 23 de marzo, las comidas de desayuno y almuerzo "Grab and Go" estarn disponibles para cualquier nio, de 18 aos o menos, de 8:30 a.m. a 12:30 p.m. en Coconino High, Cromer Elementary, Killip Elementary , Kinsey Elementary, Leupp Elementary, Marshall Elementary y Thomas Elementary. Los nios no tienen que ser estudiantes en esas escuelas o FUSD para ser atendidos.

Dear FUSD Families and Community,

After careful consideration, and authorization by the Governing Board this morning, a decision has been made to extend the closure of all schools and programs of the Flagstaff Unified School District through Friday, April 3, 2020. This decision was reached in order to help contain the spread of COVID-19, in our community.

The FUSD Incident Command Team and our staff have been monitoring the unprecedented impact of COVID-19 and taking precautions for weeks. We often say the safety of our students and staff is our top priority, and never has that been more true than at this moment. We understand
schools, working together with local and state health departments, play an important role in slowing the spread of diseases.
Evidence is mounting that social distancing is a critical part of the containment strategy.

As you know, we are coordinating with the Coconino County Health and Human Services Department and state education officials, and continue to follow all guidelines for preventing the spread of disease.

The FUSD Governing Board, leadership team, and I all believe the time has now come for an important shift as our regularly scheduled spring break ends this week and students, staff, and families return back to our community which therefore led to our recommendation to the Governing Board consider closing all FUSD schools for a full two weeks after spring break through April 3, 2020.

While we understand the significant impact this decision has on students, families, staff, and our community, we believe it best addresses our local conditions, aligns with schedules of the other educational partners, and the actions taken by the City of Flagstaff.
Team FUSD has been preparing for this possibility and has plans in place to meet student needs. Beginning Monday, March 23, we will have
Grab and Go breakfast and lunch meals available for any child, age 18 and under, Monday through Friday between 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.at the following FUSD school sites:
Children do not have to be a student at those schools or FUSD to be served.
A news release with this announcement will be posted and shared later today.

Instructional opportunities and resources will be made available to FUSD students and families to the extent possible no later than March 30, 2020. Due to equity and access issues, students may not be required to complete or be graded for their participation. During this upcoming week, teachers and staff will prepare these instructional materials and resources, and we develop procedures for teachers to connect with their students during this school closure to check on their well-being, support their access to the instructional resources, and address student/family questions.

Students who may have left behind their iPad, other work materials, band instruments medications, and/or personal items deemed essential during the school closure must contact the school in advance to schedule retrieval of these items on Monday, March 23, 2020 or as approved by the school administrator. Safety precautions will be taken and students/families will not be admitted into the school site.

We will continue to work with the Arizona Department of Education to address questions regarding instructional time, assessment, and graduation requirements and provide that information when it is available.

While this is a time of change, it is also an opportunity for all of us to reconnect with the ones we love and care for. We challenge families to also seek other opportunities to promote learning at home during this time- reading books, completing a 1000 piece puzzle, trying out a new dinner recipe, or creating a snow fort. Dont forget to make time for the arts and recess. Our students, your children, will learn significantly as you model the importance of self-care, compassion and empathy for elderly neighbors and the vulnerable members of our community, and how to work together during these challenging times.
Separate messages have been sent to Team FUSD staff regarding
procedures for their reassignment to work from home and as they will only report to our schools as needed. I am proud of the Governing Board for recognizing
that it is in the best interest of the District, and serves a public purpose, to continue to pay all permanent employees for the period of time of this school closure.

Flagstaff, and all our District communities, are filled with caring and collaborative individuals and partners who have shown time and time again their resilience and heart- be it in response to fires, floods, and ransomware attacks. I am confident it will be no different this time as we come together to fight this virus. I want to express my gratitude to our first responders and all health care staff for all they are doing today and all they will do in the coming months to provide needed care in response to COVID-19..

The Governing Board and I, along with the rest of Team FUSD are committed to keeping families informed about the services available for students during this closure. We look forward to welcoming our students back and reopening our schools as soon as we can ensure safe and healthy learning environments.
With Best Regards,
Michael Penca
Superintendent
Estimadas familias y comunidad del distrito escolar:

Despus de una cuidadosa consideracin y autorizacin de la Junta de Gobierno esta maana, se tom la decisin de extender el cierre de todas las escuelas y programas del Distrito Escolar Unificado de Flagstaff hasta el viernes 3 de abril del 2020. Esta decisin se tom para ayudar a contener la difusin de COVID-19 en nuestra comunidad.

El Equipo de Comando de Incidentes del distrito y nuestro personal han estado monitoreando el impacto sin precedentes de COVID-19 y tomando precauciones durante semanas. A menudo decimos que la seguridad de nuestros estudiantes y personal es nuestra principal prioridad, y nunca ha sido tan cierto como en este momento. Entendemos que las escuelas, en colaboracin con los departamentos de salud locales y estatales, juegan un papel importante en la disminucin de la propagacin de enfermedades. Cada vez hay ms pruebas de que el distanciamiento social es una parte crtica de la estrategia de contencin.

Como usted sabe, estamos coordinando con el Departamento de Salud y Servicios Humanos del Condado de Coconino y los funcionarios de educacin estatales, continuamos siguiendo todas las normas para prevenir la propagacin de enfermedades.

La Junta de Gobierno del distrito, el equipo de liderazgo y todos creemos que ha llegado el momento de un cambio importante ya que nuestras vacaciones de primavera programadas regularmente finalizan esta semana y los estudiantes, el personal y las familias regresan a nuestra comunidad, lo que llev a nuestra recomendacin a la Junta de Gobierno considerar cerrar todas las escuelas del distrito por dos semanas completas despus de las vacaciones de primavera hasta el 3 de abril del 2020.

Entendemos el impacto significativo que esta decisin tiene en los estudiantes, las familias, el personal y nuestra comunidad, creemos que aborda mejor nuestras condiciones locales, se alinea con los horarios de los otros socios educativos y las acciones tomadas por la Ciudad de Flagstaff.

El equipo FUSD se ha estado preparando para esta posibilidad y tiene planes establecidos para satisfacer las necesidades de los estudiantes. A partir del lunes 23 de marzo, tendremos desayunos y lonches "para llevar" disponibles para cualquier nio menores de 18 aos de edad, de lunes a viernes de 8:30 a.m. a 12:30 p.m. en los siguientes sitios escolares del distrito escolar:

Los nios no tienen que ser estudiantes de las escuelas mencionadas anteriormente o del distrito escolar en general para ser atendidos. Un comunicado de prensa con este anuncio ser publicado y compartido ms tarde el da de hoy.

Las oportunidades de instruccin y los recursos estarn disponibles para los estudiantes y las familias de FUSD en la medida posible a ms tardar el 30 de marzo del 2020. Debido a problemas de acceso e igualdad, es posible que no se requiera que los estudiantes completen o sean calificados por su participacin. Durante esta prxima semana, los maestros y el personal preparar materiales y recursos educativos, desarrollaremos procedimientos para que los maestros se conecten con sus estudiantes durante el cierre de escuelas para verificar su bienestar, apoyar su acceso a los recursos educativos y dirigirse a los estudiantes y preguntas familiares.

Continuaremos trabajando con el Departamento de Educacin de Arizona para responder preguntas sobre el tiempo de instruccin, la evaluacin y los requisitos de graduacin y proporcionar esa informacin cuando est disponible.

Si bien es un momento de cambio, tambin es una oportunidad para que todos nosotros nos reconectamos con los que amamos y cuidamos. Desafiamos a las familias a que tambin busquen otras oportunidades para promover el aprendizaje en casa durante este tiempo: leer libros, completar un rompecabezas de 1000 piezas, probar una nueva receta para la cena o divertirse con la nieve. No olviden hacer tiempo para el arte y recreo.

Nuestros estudiantes, sus hijos, aprendern significativamente a medida que modele la importancia del autocuidado, la compasin y la empata para los vecinos mayores y los miembros vulnerables de nuestra comunidad, y cmo trabajar juntos durante estos tiempos difciles.
Se enviarn mensajes por separado al Equipo FUSD con respecto a los procedimientos para su reasignacin para trabajar desde casa ya que solo informarn a nuestras escuelas segn sea necesario.

Estoy orgulloso de la junta de gobierno por reconocer que es en el mejor inters del Distrito, y sirve a un propsito pblico, continuar pagando a todos los empleados permanentes durante el perodo de tiempo de este cierre de escuelas.

Flagstaff, y todas nuestras comunidades del Distrito, estn llenas de individuos y socios solidarios y colaborativos que han demostrado una y otra vez su capacidad de recuperacin y corazn en respuesta a incendios, inundaciones y ataques cibernticos. Estoy seguro de que no ser diferente esta vez, ya que nos unimos para luchar contra este virus. Quiero expresar mi gratitud a nuestros socorristas y a todo el personal de atencin mdica por todo lo que estn haciendo hoy y todo lo que harn en los prximos meses para brindar la atencin necesaria en respuesta al coronavirus.

La Junta de Gobierno y yo, junto con el resto del Equipo FUSD, nos comprometemos a mantener a las familias informadas sobre los servicios disponibles para los estudiantes durante este cierre. Esperamos darles la bienvenida a nuestros estudiantes y reabrir nuestras escuelas tan pronto como podamos garantizar entornos de aprendizaje seguros y saludables.
Con mis mejores deseos,
Michael Penca
Superintendente

h1.aria-label: FUSD starts Grab and Go Meal Service Monday, March 23, 2020
h1.span: FUSD starts Grab and Go Meal Service Monday, March 23, 2020

p.span: The Flagstaff Unified School District will begin a grab and go breakfast and lunch food service beginning on Monday, March 23, 2020 during the unanticipated school closures due to COVID-19 outbreak. All children receiving a meal need to be physically present at the time the meal is provided.

As FUSD seeks to comply with CDC recommendations, children who receive the food service will not be allowed to dine at the facilities. Instead, all meals will have to be taken to go to ensure proper social distancing practices. Drive up options are available at each site.
Both breakfast and lunch meals will be provided for pick up only Monday through Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. at the sites and dates listed below:

li.span: Accessible via Mountain Line Routes 2 and 7
Accessible via Mountain Line Routes 4 and 14

p.span: Dates are subject to change and will be updated as necessary.

Meals will be provided to all children, ages 18 and under, without charge and are the same for all children regardless of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age and there will be no discrimination in the course of the meal service. Both meals will be picked up at the same time.

In accordance with Federal civil rights law and U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) civil rights regulations and policies, the USDA, its Agencies, offices, and employees, and institutions participating in or administering USDA programs are prohibited from discriminating based on race, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, or reprisal or retaliation for prior civil rights activity in any program or activity conducted or funded by USDA.

Persons with disabilities who require alternative means of communication for program information (e.g., Braille, large print, audiotape, American Sign Language, etc.) should contact the Agency (State or local) where they applied for benefits. Individuals who are deaf, hard of hearing or have speech disabilities may contact USDA through the Federal Relay Service at (800) 877-8339. Additionally, program information may be made available in languages other than English.

To file a program complaint of discrimination, complete the USDA Program Discrimination Complaint Form, AD-3027, found online at http://www.ascr.usda.gov/complaint_filing_cust.html, and at any USDA office, or write a letter addressed to USDA and provide in the letter all of the information requested in the form. To request a copy of the complaint form, call (866) 632-9992. Submit your completed form or letter to USDA by: (1) mail: U.S. Department of Agriculture, Office of the Assistant Secretary for Civil Rights, 1400 Independence Avenue, SW, Washington, D.C. 20250-9410; (2) fax: (202) 690-7442; or (3) email: program.intake@usda.gov.
This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

div.p: WHEREAS, Arizonas Governor and Superintendent of Public Instruction have ordered the State-wide closure of schools through at least March 27, 2020; and

WHEREAS, the Flagstaff Unified School District No. 1 of Coconino County, Arizona (District) has the authority to close schools in an emergency pursuant to A.R.S. 15-806(B), Governing Board Policy EBCD, Weather-related and Emergency Closings and Governing Board Policy ID, School Day and related Administrative Regulations; and

WHEREAS, the Governing Board finds as that it is in the best interest of the District and its community to close the schools and to carry out the actions listed below to prevent the spread of a pandemic; and

WHEREAS, the Governing Board finds that it is in the best interest of the District and serves a public purpose to continue to pay its employees for the time period of the school closure in order to maintain order in the community, reduce employee turnover, allow employees to care for the needs of their families, meet its contractual obligations and increase morale for District employees during a time of national and state emergency;
NOW, THEREFORE be it resolved by the Governing Board of Flagstaff Unified School District No. 1 of Coconino County, Arizona that:

Section 1. The Governing Board authorizes the closure of all schools and programs through Friday, April 3, 2020, prior to which time the Governing Board shall convene again to reassess the matter, unless the District has received direction from the federal or state government that removes the decision from the Governing Boards discretion.

Section 2. The Superintendent is authorized to extend the dates of school closure if necessary, consistent with Governing Board Policies EBCD and ID. In such a case, the Superintendent will so notify the Governing Board pending the opportunity for the Governing Board to convene a Governing Board meeting.

Section 3. The Superintendent is authorized to continue regular payroll expenses for all permanent (non-temporary) employees. All employees shall be expected to perform work during the school closures, as assigned by the Superintendent, either on site, at home or as otherwise assigned; those not required to work on-site shall remain on call and available to report to work as needed. Hourly (non-exempt) employees who are deemed essential and required to work on-site shall be paid at a time and a half rate. The Superintendent is authorized to modify payroll as necessary to comply with State or Federal laws that may be passed in response to COVID-19.

Section 4. The Governing Board authorizes the Superintendent to work with local and state authorities to meet minimum state requirements of instruction and to create a corresponding change to the school calendar if necessary.

Section 5. The Governing Board authorizes the Superintendent to execute all requisite documents to apply to the Arizona Department of Education for excuse of students from school attendance because of school closure pursuant to A.R.S. 15-806(B).

Section 6. The Governing Board authorizes the Superintendent to execute any further documentation to effectuate this resolution, including but not limited to any requisite notices required by the Arizona Department of Education or local/state health authorities.
This Resolution was passed and adopted by the Governing Board at a properly noticed special Governing Board meeting held on March 18, 2020.
The Governing Board hereby authorizes the Governing Board President to sign this Resolution on behalf of the Governing Board.
Signed Ms. Anne Dunno, Governing Board President

The Flagstaff Unified School District Governing Board will have discussion and possible action to adopt a Governing Board Resolution relating to school closures, employee work schedules, and related matters in response to the COVID-19 outbreak.

h1.aria-label: March 12, 2020 - Superintendent Message to FUSD Families
h1.span: March 12, 2020 - Superintendent Message to FUSD Families

p.span: Good Afternoon FUSD Parents and Guardians,

The Flagstaff Unified School District (FUSD) believes it is important to keep our families updated regarding events that may impact our services. Our administrative team is closely monitoring information related to COVID-19 and coordinating with the Coconino County Health Department, the Arizona Department of Health, and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) where appropriate. FUSD is aware that other educational entities in the community and nationally are changing their schedules based on their particular circumstances. We do not have any changes to our current schedule at this time and look forward to our scheduled Spring Break next week - March 16 through March 20.

According to the CDC, this is a rapidly changing situation and we are committed to update stakeholders regarding changes to practices in the event that the risk assessment changes. FUSD encourages individuals to
Our commitment is to keep you up to date with FUSD information as it is available. Additional information will be shared during Spring Break in anticipation of the following week.

While the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases are steadily growing in the United States, there are local travel restrictions in impacted areas. It is recommended that all individuals check with area health department websites prior to travel.
What can you do while traveling?

li.span: Avoid touching your eyes, nose, or mouth.
Clean hands often by washing them with soap and water for at least 20 seconds or using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60%-95% alcohol when soap and water is not available.
It is especially important to clean hands after going to the restroom; before eating; and after coughing, sneezing or blowing your nose.

p.span: Symptoms of fever, cough, or difficulty breathing need to be taken very seriously. After returning to Flagstaff, it is important to self-monitor for 14 days. This means people should remain alert for concerning respiratory symptoms. If your child or any family members feel feverish or develop cough or difficulty breathing during the self-observation period (14 days), they should take their temperature, limit contact with others, and seek health advice by telephone from a healthcare provider or their local health department to determine whether medical evaluation is needed.
With that in mind, we remind all of our students, families, and team members to take the following precautions, to keep our schools healthy:

li.span: Get a flu shot if possible
Wash your hands frequently with soap and water for a minimum of 20 seconds
Keep common area surfaces clean with disinfecting wipes
Stay home if you are feeling ill

p.b: Ill students need to stay home or will be sent home upon the following symptoms:

p.span: Adults and students are to stay home if they are ill and should not return to school or work until they are fever free for 72 hours without taking a fever reducing medication like ibuprofen or Tylenol. Anyone with a positive COVID-19 test cannot return for school or work for 7 days after receiving a healthy test result.

If FUSD is alerted that any type of community spread of COVID-19 is occurring in Coconino County, we will immediately follow all protocols set forth by the Coconino County Health and Human Services Department. In an abundance of caution, our administrative team is developing contingency plans for students and staff in case we need to alter our services in the future.
For additional information and past messages, please visit
Sincerely,
Michael A. Penca
Superintendent
Buenas tardes padres y tutores del FUSD,

El Distrito Escolar Unificado de Flagstaff (FUSD) cree que es importante mantener a nuestras familias actualizadas con respecto a los eventos que pueden afectar nuestros servicios. Nuestro equipo administrativo est monitoreando de cerca la informacin relacionada con COVID-19 y coordinando con el Departamento de Salud del Condado de Coconino, el Departamento de Salud de Arizona y los Centros para el Control y la Prevencin de Enfermedades (CDC), segn corresponda. FUSD es consciente de que otras entidades educativas en la comunidad y a nivel nacional estn cambiando sus horarios en funcin de sus circunstancias particulares. No tenemos ningn cambio en nuestro horario actual en este momento y esperamos nuestras vacaciones de primavera programadas para la prxima semana, del 16 al 20 de marzo.

Segn los los Centros para el Control y la Prevencin de Enfermedades, esta es una situacin que cambia rpidamente y estamos comprometidos a actualizar a las partes interesadas con respecto a los cambios en las prcticas en caso de que cambie la evaluacin de riesgos. FUSD alienta a las personas a leer ms de los CDC.

Nuestro compromiso es mantenerlo actualizado con la informacin del distrito escolar a medida que est disponible. Se compartir informacin adicional durante las vacaciones de primavera antes de la semana siguiente.

Si bien el nmero de casos confirmados de COVID-19 est creciendo constantemente en los Estados Unidos, existen restricciones locales de viaje en las reas afectadas. Se recomienda que todas las personas consulten los sitios web del departamento de salud del rea antes de viajar.

li.span: Evitar el contacto con personas enfermas.
Evita tocar tus ojos, nariz o boca.

Lvese las manos a menudo lavndose con agua y jabn durante al menos 20 segundos o utilizando un desinfectante para manos a base de alcohol que contenga al menos 60% -95% de alcohol cuando no haya agua y jabn disponibles.
Es especialmente importante lavarse las manos despus de ir al bao; antes de comer; y despus de toser, estornudar o sonarse la nariz.

hr.p: Los sntomas de fiebre, tos o dificultad para respirar deben tomarse muy en serio. Despus de regresar a Flagstaff, es importante observarse durante 14 das. Esto significa que las personas deben permanecer alertas ante los sntomas respiratorios. Si su hijo o algn miembro de la familia siente con fiebre o desarrolla tos o dificultad para respirar durante el perodo de observacin de s mismo (14 das), debe tomar su temperatura, limitar el contacto con otras personas y buscar asistencia mdica por telfono con un proveedor de atencin mdica o su proveedor local o el departamento de salud para determinar si se necesita una evaluacin mdica.

p.b: Prcticas Saludables y Procedimientos de Enfermedad

p.span: Con eso en mente, les recordamos a todos nuestros estudiantes, familias y miembros del equipo que tomen las siguientes precauciones para mantener nuestras escuelas saludables:

li.span: Lvese las manos con frecuencia con agua y jabn durante un mnimo de 20 segundos.
Cubra la tos y los estornudos
Mantenga limpias las superficies del rea comn con toallitas desinfectantes
Qudese en casa si se siente enfermo

p.span: Los estudiantes enfermos deben quedarse en casa o sern enviados a casa con los siguientes sntomas:

Los adultos y los estudiantes deben quedarse en casa si estn enfermos y no deben regresar a la escuela o al trabajo hasta que estn libres de fiebre durante 72 horas sin tomar un medicamento antifebril como ibuprofeno o Tylenol. Cualquier persona con una prueba COVID-19 positiva no puede regresar a la escuela o al trabajo durante 7 das despus de recibir un resultado de prueba saludable.

Si se alerta al distrito escolar de que se est produciendo cualquier tipo de propagacin comunitaria de COVID-19 en el Condado de Coconino, seguiremos de inmediato todos los protocolos establecidos por el Departamento de Salud y Servicios Humanos del Condado de Coconino. Con mucha precaucin, nuestro equipo administrativo est desarrollando planes de contingencia para estudiantes y personal en caso de que necesitemos alterar nuestros servicios en el futuro.
Para obtener informacin adicional y mensajes anteriores, visite
Sinceramente,
Michael A. Penca
Superintendent

h1.aria-label: March 11, 2020: FHS Chicago Marching Band Trip Canceled
h1.span: March 11, 2020: FHS Chicago Marching Band Trip Canceled

div.p: In response to the cancellation of the Chicago St. Patrick's Day Parade, the Flagstaff High School Band Marching Trip has been canceled. A meeting with FHS Band families has been scheduled for Thursday, March 12th for updates regarding the decision.

h1.aria-label: March 9, 2020: Travel Alert - Important Information for Student Travel
h1.span: March 9, 2020: Travel Alert - Important Information for Student Travel

p.span: Parents/Families, in anticipation of your child's scheduled school-sponsored trip, please take a moment and talk with your child about the items below to encourage awareness of precautions to take to promote health and well-being while traveling. While the number of confirmed coronavirus disease (COVID-19) is steadily growing in the United States,there are no travel restrictions by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to locations of this trip at this time.

i.span: What can you do while traveling?

li.span: Avoid touching your eyes, nose, or mouth.

Clean your hands often by washing them with soap and water for at least 20 seconds or using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60%-95% alcohol when soap and water is not available.
It is especially important to clean hands after going to the restroom; before eating; and after coughing, sneezing or blowing your nose.
Students are encouraged to bring supplies of hand sanitizer, tissues, and disinfectant wipes for use on the airplane and in high traffic areas.

p.span: Symptoms of fever, cough, or difficulty breathing need to be taken very seriously. After returning to Flagstaff, it is important to self-monitor for 14 days. This means people should remain alert for concerning respiratory symptoms. If your student or any family members feel feverish or develop cough or difficulty breathing during the self-observation period (14 days), they should take their temperature, limit contact with others, and seek health advice by telephone from a healthcare provider or their local health department to determine whether medical evaluation is needed.
FUSD is following guidelines and recommendations from Coconino County Health and Human Services,
Arizona Department of Health, and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).
For more information please visit the official CDC website

The Flagstaff Unified School District believes it is important to keep our community updated regarding events that may impact our services. Team FUSD is closely monitoring information related to Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) and coordinating with the Coconino County Health Department, the Arizona Department of Health, and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

According to the CDC, "For the general American public, who are unlikely to be exposed to this virus at this time, the immediate health risk from COVID-19 is considered low." However, FUSD will continue to monitor the situation and will update stakeholders regarding changes to practices in the event that the risk assessment changes. In situations like this, we don't want false information to cause undue anxiety or stress, therefore you are encouraged to visit the CDC website and

Additionally, it is currently flu and respiratory disease season in Arizona, and with that in mind, we remind all of our staff to take the following precautions, no matter what time of year it is, to keep our schools healthy:

li.span: Get a flu shot if possible
Wash hands frequently with soap and water for a minimum of 20 seconds
Cover your cough and sneezes with a tissue and immediately wash your hands
Keep common area surfaces clean with disinfecting wipes
Avoid touching eyes, nose, and mouth

p.span: People who have the following symptoms need to stay home:

li.span: Rash and fever or a rash that is contagious

p.span: If we are alerted that any type of community exposure has occurred in Coconino County, we will immediately follow all protocols set forth by the Coconino County Health Department. While there is no cause for alarm, our administrative team is developing contingency plans for students and staff in case we need to alter our services in the future. If you have any questions or concerns, as always, please feel free to speak with your school site administrator.
As more information is available, FUSD will continue to update at
